Module main
Package com.vtuberrush.src.managers

Class WaveManager

java.lang.Object
com.vtuberrush.src.managers.WaveManager
public class WaveManager extends Object
Facilitates the spawning of waves or groups of enemies in set intervals.
Version:
0.0.1-alpha.1
Author:
Gio Carlo Ciudadano

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    WaveManager​(Playing playing)
    Initializes and creates a list of waves for the player to defend against.

    Method
    Description
    void

    Starts a timer which spawns the next wave after 5 seconds.

    Returns the next enemy in the Wave enemy type list.

    getTimeLeft()
    Returns the amount of time remaining before the next wave.

    Returns the current wave number.
    ArrayList<Wave>
    getWaves()
    Returns an array list whose members are Wave objects.
    void

    Increments the wave index by one, resets the wave delay timer, and defines the next enemy to be spawned as the enemy in the first index of the next wave.
    boolean

    Returns true if the timer used to spawn the next enemy in the wave is more than 1.25 seconds.

    Returns true if there are still available enemies to be spawned in the wave.

    Returns true if there are still waves to be spawned.

    Returns true if the timer used to spawn the next wave is more than 5 seconds.
    void
    resetGame()
    Resets all timers, wave numbers, and enemy indices.
    void
    tick()
    Updates game timers used for controlling the delay of spawning between enemies and the delay for spawning enemies between waves.

  • Constructor Details

    • WaveManager

      public WaveManager​(Playing playing)
      Initializes and creates a list of waves for the player to defend against. Created when initializing the PLAYING game state.
      Parameters:
      playing - - Defines the specific instance of the scene where the wave manager is initialized.
      See Also:
      initWaves()

  • Method Details

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Updates game timers used for controlling the delay of spawning between enemies and the delay for spawning enemies between waves.
      See Also:
      isAddEnemyNext(), isAddWaveNext()

    • delayWaveStart

      public void delayWaveStart()
      Starts a timer which spawns the next wave after 5 seconds.
      Called when all enemies in a wave have been killed and the user is ready to accept another wave of enemies.

    • initNextWave

      public void initNextWave()
      Increments the wave index by one, resets the wave delay timer, and defines the next enemy to be spawned as the enemy in the first index of the next wave.

    • isWaveDelayEnd

      public boolean isWaveDelayEnd()
      Returns true if the timer used to spawn the next wave is more than 5 seconds.
      Used to check and spawn the next wave if set to false.
      Returns:
      waveDelayEnd

    • isAddEnemy

      public boolean isAddEnemy()
      Returns true if the timer used to spawn the next enemy in the wave is more than 1.25 seconds.
      Used to check whether to spawn a new enemy.

    • isAddEnemyNext

      public boolean isAddEnemyNext()
      Returns true if there are still available enemies to be spawned in the wave.
      Used for spawning a new wave and stopping spawns in a spawned wave.

    • isAddWaveNext

      public boolean isAddWaveNext()
      Returns true if there are still waves to be spawned.
      Used to end the game if all enemies were spawned and killed.

    • getWaves

      public ArrayList<Wave> getWaves()
      Returns an array list whose members are Wave objects.
      Returns:
      waves

    • getWaveIndex

      public int getWaveIndex()
      Returns the current wave number.
      Returns:
      waveIndex

    • getNextEnemy

      public int getNextEnemy()
      Returns the next enemy in the Wave enemy type list.
      Resets the timer used to delay the spawning between enemies in a wave.
      Returns:
      waveIndex

    • getTimeLeft

      public float getTimeLeft()
      Returns the amount of time remaining before the next wave.

    • isTimerStart

      public boolean isTimerStart()
      Returns true if the timer used to delay the spawning between waves is currently active.

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets all timers, wave numbers, and enemy indices.
      Called during a game over or game complete condition.
